name: base2stay Liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love this hotel. Have stayed a couple of times with my boyfriend (we are 23 and 21) - once in September 2011 and again in February this year.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: First of all, the staff are absolutley brilliant. Very helpful and very friendly. They advise the best places to eat, the best bars, anything you need to know they will try to help.
reviews.title: Will come back. Close to city centre, Albert's dock, station, free wifi

reviews.text: Extremely clean with lovely rooms and bathrooms. Very comfortable place to stay. Rooms also have a kitchenette (Microwave, Fridge, Sink, Cutlry, Glasses)
reviews.title: Fantastic Place!!!

reviews.text: You feel very safe here - to get into the hotel, you either press the button for reception to let you in, or you put your room card to a little sensor on the wall. You also need your card to use the lifts and to get through the doors on the ground floor.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: It is quite a walk from Liverpool Lime Street Station, but it's not hard to find when you know where it is. Short walk into the main shopping area. Concert square is right next door but you do not hear any noise from the bars and clubs. There is a brilliant bar just up the road called Alma de Cuba - would recommend for food and live music.
reviews.title: maybe I'm missing something

reviews.text: Superb attention to detail. Excellent rooms and service. My only gripe is that they are so popular I have struggled to book again!
reviews.title: Just fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel - will be back!
reviews.title: Top notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Newly converted to the highest standards, this apartment was faultless. Good pressure on the water, nice little kitchenette, blackout curtains and completely soundproofed even though you are in the heart of clubland. Brilliantly central location for shops and restaurants and the car park above Tesco (get your discount voucher from reception) at £9.50 per day is well lit and secure. Good value for money.
reviews.title: place 2 stay is base 2 stay

reviews.text: Fantastic location, five minute walk to liverpool 1 and its shops bars and restaurants. Lots of clubs,bars and restaurants just around the corner, plus a Tesco at the bottom of the road. Hotel was contemporary and stylish with excellent security. Rooms were comfortable and spotless with basic self catering facilities . Can highly recommend this hotel for a weekend break in Liverpool.
reviews.title: Excellent value, good location

reviews.text: Although it’s downtown Liverpool it’s quiet. My room had triple glazing. The area itself is rather grotty and run down but it seemed safe enough. The décor was refreshingly different and the “mini kitchen” was great. You only have a microwave to cook with, but that’s 100% more than you get in most hotel rooms. The wifi is free. Plenty of restaurants nearby, along with town centre and the universities. Staff were helpful. Good value for a budget business trip – I’ll stay again.
reviews.title: Something different...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I spent a lovely night at Base2Stay this week and were really impressed with it. We had booked the room through our Avios points (who have been terrible from start to finish) and they had not sent the booking to the hotel, therefore when we arrived nobody knew we were coming. We spent an hour on the phone dealing with Avios whilst the receptionists did anything they could to help. They also upgraded our room despite the problem being nothing to do with them.
reviews.title: What a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we were in we were really happy with the room, a lovely big comfy bed, and a wee kitchen ish area which would be perfect if you were travelling for business. Every receptionist we spoke to was lovely and helpful and we received some excellent recommendations for lunch, dinner and drinks.
reviews.title: Stylish modern apartment hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area we stayed in was great fun full of trendy bars, cafes and shops we really enjoyed just mosying around there but were also within walking distance of the shops and docks.
reviews.title: Stylish Hotel Central to all Amenities by Foot

reviews.text: The only negative about our trip was the breakfast box, which was delivered to our room. It contained a yogurt, a brioche, some cereal a pint of milk and some fruit juice all of which were low quality, for £6 it would be better to go to a local cafe. But this didn't detract at all from a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: We booked this hotel because we wanted to spend the night in Liverpool before visiting the Anthony Gormley statues on Crosby beach, very early the next morning. Base2Stay was perfect for this because there was a fridge to store food, and you pay on arrival, so we could leave quickly in the morning. It was in a quiet area which has not been modernised. The receptionist did not recommend leaving the car on the street overnight, but the hotel offers a concession voucher for a nearby car park. The room was very modern, with plenty of room and a big shower. It was amazing value for money. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I can't fault the experience at base2stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. My single room had good connectivity with the world and a roomy bathroom with a roomy shower. The public spaces were modern, simple, attractive. No unnecessary bling but good design. it's in the middle of Liverpool's night-time district with a lot of choices for eating and drinking in easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Simple and stylish

reviews.text: Fantastic place. Great location. Super friendly staff. The rooms are grand if not a tad soulless. Great having kitchenette. The only drawback was the really uncomfortable mattress. Felt like a cheap one. Despite this I was really impressed and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Fab place shame about mattress.

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights during the Jubliee BH week booking 2 standard rooms and got a very good rate booking directly via the hotel website. The rooms were not the biggest I've stayed in but were absolutely fine for our stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Loved Liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone has already mentioned the good things like the free wi-fi, kitchenette area, good prices which make base2stay good value. However I think the main thing that takes this place above others is the service and friendliness of the staff. I have stayed at many hotels where the service cannot be faulted but it is perfunctory. All of the staff at base2stsay were genuinely friendly, always with a smile, a morning greeting and advice on directions, where to go etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.

reviews.text: We also had the pleasure of meeting Robert Nadler (who I had seen on the website and thought was the manager but is actually the CEO!!!). IT was great to meet him and we had a long discussion about the hotel concept, future plans and Liverpool FC. Having bought a new football at Anfield, he even asked myGodson to show him his football skills in the hotel lounge area!! Meeting him was the icing on the cake and his friendliness was indicative of the service we encountered thoughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect 'Base2Stay' for a family break!

description: base2stay Liverpool offers a unique combination of 4* comfort, design and service. All rooms offer A/C, mini-kitchens, free WiFi + free internet, music & games on HDTVs. Without a bar or restaurant, it’s ideally suited to the RopeWalks, Liverpool city centre’s vibrant design quarter. Enjoy exclusive discounts at some of Liverpool’s best bars and restaurants, with which this boutique hotel is surrounded and 30 minutes of free local & national calls per day.
